column4: ive got some dependency problems with apt which i cant seem to solve.......im trying to install gcc-4.0 and it says "Depends: gcc-4.0-base (= 4.0.1-4ubuntu9) but 4.0.2-5 is to be installer
and also with cpp-4.0 it says it depends on it
are you on dapper?
wahts dapper
it's the unstable version of Ubuntu. I'm asking because 4.0.2 should not be in the current stable version, which is Breezy.
oh.....im in breezy
well for some reason thats whats installed
and just from breezy repositories.....i tried disabling all other repositories
wait, i didnt re-install the packages....how do i get it to downgrade the package?
with pinning, but I can't remember how you do it.
check out the menu in Synaptic for ways to lock a particular version.
read ubotu's message pls.
ok thanks
it seems that the stuff at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PinningHowto dosent stop it trying to remove all the packages dependencys
can I give you another RTFM type source?
yes
http://www.linux.com/article.pl?sid=05/10/12/1952217
I find this type of problem is difficult to solve on IRC. Do feel free to ask everyone again, though. You may yet find an expert.
i got it sorted....i just had to install the older packages using dpkg
I'm glad.
thanks
